titlestmt.titleproper:
Preliminary Guide to the Charles Carroll Carter papers, 1924-1981
MS2180
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-01-11 11:40:35 -0500.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.abstract: This collection contains correspondence, speeches, clippings, videos, and slides. This material dates from 1969-89 with the bulk falling between 1968-1973. The slides document mass transit operations throughout the world including Tokyo, Singapore, Toronto, Montreal, and Hong Kong. Most of the correspondence and memos are those Carter sent and is primarily business related although there are personal letters. The collection also contains files related to Urban Systems that were probably gathered by Carter for his work. The majority of the collection is slides.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Charles Carroll Carter papers, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Although this collection is open for research the unprocessed status will require staff to review all files before a researcher is allowed to use for research. Researchrers should be aware of this and build this time into a research plan.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Charles Carroll Carter, April 30, 1992.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Charles Carroll Carter (b. August 6, 1928- ) worked as both the Assistant Secretary of Transporation and Special Assistant to the Secretary of Transportation and Assistant Administrator for Public Affairs Urban Mass Transportation Administration in the Nixon and Ford adminstration. Carter also served as Executive Director of the International Mass Transit Association. From 1974-1988, Carter served as publisher/editor of Mass Transit, an international magazine on urban public transportation. The transportation related correspondence is from numerous geovernment officials, political figures, and business executives.
Charles Carroll Carter received his B.A. from the University of Notre Dame in 1949 and a MBA from the American University in 1959.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence, speeches, clippings, videos, and slides. This material dates from 1969-89 with the bulk falling between 1968-1973. The slides document mass transit operations throughout the world including Tokyo, Singapore, Toronto, Montreal, and Hong Kong. There are slides of the construction of Washington, D.C.'s metro. Most of the correspondence and memos are those Carter sent and is primarily business related although there are personal letters. The collection also contains files related to Urban Systems that were probably gathered by Carter for his work. The majority of the collection is slides.

arrangement.head: Collection Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is not processed and series have not yet been determined.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: This collection is not yet processed. Please see staff for assistance.
